title: What is Riot's take on Global Ults?
body:
Are they going to take away Gangplank's global pressure in exchange for the solid damage?
He is very fine right now. As well as Shen. They are unique and stand in a relatively good position.
I'm kind of worried that two of my favorite champions get their ults gutted.

replies.body:
We don't currently have any plans to remove any of the global ults in the game and in fact have a couple more in testing that are showing a lot of promise right now (at least one of which I expect you'll see in game at some point). 

When global ults have been problematic in the past (Panth/TF years ago for example) it's been because they've been free targeted movement abilities. Shen's ult by contrast shifts him to an ally's location, not any spot of his choosing, and that restriction avoids a lot of problems (forcing uneven fights at positioning of your choosing without risk of interuption, telegraph moving to get in range etc). GP's ult is free targeted, but doesn't move him, so doesn't create the same problem cases.
@Meddler Do any of those ultimates involve something similar to GPs but more burst oriented? Ive always wanted something like that where it has a visual delay, but deals great damage.
That would be Ziggs.  It's not truly global, but hey, it exists, so you can imagine the reasons it is the way it is.

I don't really know what to say about this. I've never really been shut down on shen. If the laner is really agressive and shoves me under turret I usually am able to taunt him under the turret and chunk him so I can get back to even in the lane, or my jungler just walks top and gets a super free kill. I rarely "lose" my lane as shen on top, but then again I try to coordinate with my jungler to get an early gank if we can easily kill the lane (like ganking a ryze or darius) or I just make sure to put myself in a good position to back at 6 and make an aggressive play.

For his taunt, it is very punishing if you miss, but the hitbox seems to be decently forgiving. If your character model touches the champ, most times I see him taunt them. Also, many times I see them outside of the range indicator, but I still taunt them even though I shouldn't have simply because the champion models were close at the end of the taunt although they weren't touching. Shen does suffer if he misses a taunt, but with his Ki strike to get him back his energy, I rarely find myself useless since I run AS marks and get the 5% AS mastery so I can help energy regain.

Shen is definitely not a super strong pick, but I am super comfortable on tanks, and since Shen is rarely played, there is a simple bonus because most people forget, or don't even know, how to play against him. I do think that's the reason I feel good about playing shen, and why I think he's in a good spot. He isn't OP at all, because he has strongly defined strengths and weaknesses, and although the meta doesn't favor global pressure tanks right now, his niche is not "meta" but especially in soloq, being able to ult your bottom lane at 6 and push the enemy out of bot into a drag rotation is really strong and has won countless games for my team. 

I guess I'm just a shen fan-boy, but I really do think he's in a great place, but takes some time to learn how to use his global ult and have the map awareness to make the clutch ult plays everyone hates.

gee, lemme guess, they're gonna be attached to ADcs, cuz why shouldn't sustained dps oriented characters have massive range nukes, right?

Speaking of Twisted Fate, there's an idea I had for a change to his ultimate that I think would be interesting and thematic. It would be a global skill shot similar to Ezreal's (visually I pictured it to be one large, spinning card), and would still allow him to gate to its location. I think it could be a nice buff to his burst (if given damage) and (depending on the speed of the projectile) give him more counter play, particularly if he tries to use it as an escape or to initiate.

another extension of that becomes possible is a variable length cooldown depending on distance travelled, likely exponential. In that case I would not give the skill any extra damage.

Ok, lemme get this straight. TF does NOT NEED BUFFS, by any means. He has an ez landing phase, strong pressure, hard CC, and mana restoration. He has pushing power, and the ability to play multiple roles(ADC, APC). While he is not OP, he is strong, and in no need of buffs.
They're ok with global ults, but not global passives from my understanding.  I think they should be fine.
Halp no more Zilean passive. =(

Shen and Gangplank are far from fine, they are some of the weakest champions in League (Shen can't stack up to other top laners, and Gangplank flat out can't go in any role besides support, and even as a support he's outshined by dedicated support champions and Morgana.)  Shen needs his cooldown on his ult reduced heavily, and Gangplank just needs to get a new passive and E, and to up the AP scaling on his ultimate.

Have you tried GP jungle? He's not all that bad.
But yes, I completely agree with you on needing a new passive and E.

GP Jungle is really clunky.  His W's cooldown is just too long for heavy jungle sustain when someone like Xin Zhao gets it for free and has stronger ganks.  The solution I had in my fan rework was to up the cooldown, but have it drop a second each time GP is hit by a champion or large minion/jungle monster.  That would help his sustain without him just being able to completely ignore any crowd control that hits him due to negligible cooldowns.

I think 'clunky' describes GP perfectly at the moment. He can do almost anything, it's just that he can't do it very well.
That is an excellent idea for his W. I am working on a discussion of potential changes to GP and I think that would work really well for him.
